Reviews.Title: “good staff centrall location”
Reviews.Author: esmeray s
Reviews.Content: My and my family had a great time in this hotel. Staff are very friendly and the rooms were very clean. We were very close to all the major sights. The Manager â€˜mr erhanâ€™ was very helpful with all of our requests. I will definitely by staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not great”
Reviews.Author: bette1stl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights in March/April 2012. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are not laid out particularly well. But the location is fantastic. It's kind of bare bones by American standards, for example, only soap and shampoo is provided, no conditioner, no bottled water, etc. But for a basic place, it's a-okay, and the wi-fi is pretty fast. One odd thing though is that we found a MUCH better price online than was advertised at the hotel itself (fairly common), but our travel agent, who found the place for us, was also charged a heftier price than what we later found online. Not cool. Get with it, people.

Reviews.Title: “I found very amazing”
Reviews.Author: _mer_Istanbul
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing. The touristic areas were only 5 minutes wlk. The restaurant has a very nice view of the Blue Mosque. The internet conection was really good. The staff gave us a lot of recommendations about tours. The place was clean and the size of the room was ok. The furniture was good.

Reviews.Title: “A great location with transport on the doorstep”
Reviews.Author: ttoli
Reviews.Content: For My 1st visit to Istanbul, I don't think that I could have chosen a better location or Hotel, Clean, warm,central and comfortable. The Manager Talat, very friendly and efficient. The tram stop a mere 3 mins walk away as are many good bars and restaurants I'll certainly be going back Rooms though basic were clean warm and comfortable and at Â£ 30 per night (b&b) for a single, very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, yet hard to find.”
Reviews.Author: travellingman1352
Reviews.Content: Best Nobel is located in a lane in old Istanbul it is easy walking distance to the sights and sounds of the old capital. Because of congestion our taxi driver dropped us off, or should I say threw us out? And gave us incomprehensible directions to the hotel. We got there about half an hour later in the rabbit warren of lanes. It turned out we were always near to it. Staff were quite pleasant and accodating but the hotel is a little tacky. We booked a non-smoking room but were first given a room which stank of smoke. They readilly changed us to another room in which the a/c was filthy and smelled up the room when turned on. We turned it off and opened the window. Our room was on the top floor but the elevator ended at the floor below. It was a struggle with the luggage. Breakfast was great every morning with a wide variety to choose from. Numerous restaurants and street cafes are everywhere around the hotel and tourists wander around the streets till the early morning hours. When we were leaving the hotel arranged a shuttle, for a fee, to the airport. This was a great help.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: hongkong88-11
Reviews.Content: having stayed at this boutique hotel 3 times in the last year, can recommend it without hesitation. while rooms might be a bit smaller, they always were very clean and with crisp linen

Reviews.Title: “"very nÄ±ce hotel "wonderfull holiday"”
Reviews.Author: henrymetin s
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel last year with my girlfriend.Ä± lÄ±ked this hotel very good nÄ±ce very comfortable.the people very friendly.Hotel room was clean and sufficient for our needs.the best nobel hotel is big and new.it isnt expensive.The hotel was great.All things was beautiful.The service was great, the meals were fantastic.very delicious. istanbul is fantastic and touristic city.the weather was lovely.Ä±t s hot.there are restaurants from every country.Ä± lÄ±ke turksh foods.Ä± was very happy to be theree.we will go to istanbul next summer of course again this hotel "THE BEST NOBEL HOTEL :)"

Reviews.Title: “central location free wifi and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: mustafa k
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice and located in good place for shopping and nearist to the see where the view is amazing, nice staff and so cooperative especially the front office , and i recommend every one to travel to turkey to stay there , thanks the all staff

Reviews.Title: “best choice”
Reviews.Author: lacino2
Reviews.Content: Best Nobel Hotel My friends and I stayed as a guest in every sense, and really satisfied with the city center of Istanbul and transportation olduk.konum quite old as the city can easily reach everything kolay.aradÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ±z palaces, mosques and museums, of course, also the staff warm, friendly and I thank for their hospitality actually my friends for breakfast, cleaning rooms and were very pleased, finding solutions for any kind of problems Think about what other people in a clean and friendly people ... and of course a central location, is also very advantageous Wants

Reviews.Title: “PÃ–RFEK”
Reviews.Author: ahmetcal88
Reviews.Content: Best Nobel Hotel'...Because of my job;every year I stay in Sirkeci.every tÄ±me Ä± stay different hotels.I can say that I try nearly all of it and so the last one was Best Nobel. I and my friends enjoyed our time at this hotel. If you are a obsessed person about cleanÄ±ng like me:)you can prefer Best nobel.Because there was a shower in the toilet plus towels which were changed daily like beds make-up and soap. That's basically all I need.Ä± found the reception area very clean also.The staffs,especially Talat,are very helpful and friendly. This was a very bÄ±g comfort for me.First night, I found my room a bit big,because most of the time I was out, so there wasn't necessity for a larger room in my case,than I told and they changed.if you want a clean, friendly, well located hotel...I would recommend this one. and also ; the location of hotel is perfect for walking everywhere in mid-town and beyond. You can go walking to historical place and enjoy the magnificent sights of Istanbul. In summary;it is the best hotel like it's name'best nobel',I've ever stayed . one day,Ä±f you have a chance to come to Sirkeci,you should stay there. Thanks for everything....

Reviews.Title: “such a wonderful one week'”
Reviews.Author: deryademirbas
Reviews.Content: Best Nobel Hotel'...Because of my job;every year I stay in Sirkeci.every tÄ±me Ä± stay different hotels.I can say that I try nearly all of it and so the last one was Best Nobel. I and my friends enjoyed our time at this hotel. If you are a obsessed person about cleanÄ±ng like me:)you can prefer Best nobel.Because there was a shower in the toilet plus towels which were changed daily like beds make-up and soap. That's basically all I need.Ä± found the reception area very clean also.The staffs,especially Talat,are very helpful and friendly. This was a very bÄ±g comfort for me.First night, I found my room a bit big,because most of the time I was out, so there wasn't necessity for a larger room in my case,than I told and they changed.if you want a clean, friendly, well located hotel...I would recommend this one. and also ; the location of hotel is perfect for walking everywhere in mid-town and beyond. You can go walking to historical place and enjoy the magnificent sights of Istanbul. In summary;it is the best hotel like it's name'best nobel',I've ever stayed . one day,Ä±f you have a chance to come to Sirkeci,you should stay there. Thanks for everything.... Derya DemirbaÅŸ

Reviews.Title: “begendim yolculugumu (best trip at best hotel)”
Reviews.Author: lusine a
Reviews.Content: It was an amazing expression of Istanbul staying at "Best nobel hotel". The staff are the best I have ever encountered, they are helpful, informative, friendli and extremely professional (I must say a particular thanke you to mr Okan, mr Telat and mr Mustafa for their help during my recent stay) they will do anything to make your stay more comfortable. They are very friendli too. My room was very cosy and nice, the bed was so comfortable for and dream to sleep in. Also the location of hotel is perfect for walking everywhere in mid-town and beyond. You can go walking to historical place and enjoy the magnificent sights of Istanbul. I like this city and the hotel I stayed in was marvellous. I can recomend this hotel to everyone because here you will be pleasantly surprised with hospitality and friendship of Turkish people. I hope I'll visit this city again. HERKESE COK TESEKKURLER.

Reviews.Title: “it was very nice ich liebe istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Batuhan H
Reviews.Content: it was second time i went to istanbul with my wife. first time i stayed at diffirent hotel i wont say its name it was terrible but this time everything was very nice. personels are professionel hotel is close to Ayasofya- GÃ¼lhane Park, Sultanahmet hotel position is perfeckt breakfast was very very very gut for me. you can ask everything to reception. especially Mr. Okan has experience about istanbul very well. if you wanna go to city tour or restourants you should ask to first reception which is better. they have to make to their guests glad because of that they know which places are nice for you. My room was ok to me. first i stayed at first floor but my sleep is so soft and close to hotel some restourants make so noissy but Kein problem i asked to Mr. Okan and He changed my room. Danke FÃ¼r Alles

Reviews.Title: “A shocking experience...”
Reviews.Author: Zufuhrstr
Reviews.Content: I really have no idea on from where I should start! Let's give it a try...: First of all the prime impact when you enter the lobby is horrible. A mixture of old degraded smell and an non-smiling personal will "welcome". A prelude of what's to come! Secondly a feeling of dirtiness and disappointment will make you realize what a bad choice I've made. But all this are nothing in front the shocking news that we cannot share the room -me and my fiancee- cause we are not married!!! They asked us for a marriage certificate!!! So to make it short, we ended up tired, with our suitcases looking for a new hotel! I really shocking experience that we will never-EVER forget!

Reviews.Title: “LOOOOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alee1001
Reviews.Content: The staff was sooo friendly, the place is surrounded by stores and restaurants, a great one recommended by the staff. the mosque and every other touristic site is walking distance, the room was clean, spacious and the breakfast was full and very good in its own turkish way. Recommended for families and people who dont want to spend time bargaining with taxis and who like friendly staff and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria G
Reviews.Content: Good location if you want to live in historical part of Istanbul, comfortable and clean hotel, fresh breakfast, very polite and responsive personal! :) I lived in single room, it was small but very cozy, so I had no any troubles with that.

Reviews.Title: “Realy it's nice& clean hotel, the staff was very decent people, and i recommend all people to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Karika94
Reviews.Content: Nice place, decent staff, statisfied with the prices, i will be back to the hotel in my next visit to istanbul, and i will advise my friends to stay in best nobel hotel if they will stay in istanbul, realy it's nice& quite place.

Reviews.Title: “"Nice & Cozy..."”
Reviews.Author: dalzia
Reviews.Content: I found this Hotel to be atmospherical, almost charming place to stay. It's located at the Sirkeci district, which area is ideal for many reasons. Important sites like "Hagia Sophia", "Underground Cisterns", "Topkapi-Palace", "Blue Mosque" and an " Archaelogical Museum " -from where one finds for example Babylonian artifacts- are just by few minutes walking distance from the "Best Nobel-Hotel". Bosphorus is just some stone-throw away with lots of many boats criss-crossing with wonderful sights around. Small room DIDN'T bother me personally AT ALL, because I just slept, washed myself, changed clothes and fixed bought items there etc.. Most of the time I was out, so there wasn't REAL necessity for a larger room in MY case. There was a TV, free safety-box and shower in the toilet plus towels (which were changed DAILY like beds make-up) and soap. That's basically all I need, but I'm only writing on behalf of my needs, not someone else's - these things may VARY according to individuals, some may require more space to move but I think my room was one of those smaller ones. If there's a dead fly in the corner or odd-coloured tapestry etc., who cares? Staying is only temporary - besides I spent couple of nights off.. Hotel was easy to come and go despite it's being situated on the area where are lots of people, traffic and many, many other Hotels. Those were also mainly of medium-sizes or smaller, not these giant "Hyatts" or "Radissons" etc. which were mostly to be found on "Taksim"-area with their Congress-Centers and so on. Personnel was decent and friendly. Breakfast was good (buffet) in Turkish style with 'Mehmet' taking good care of it with his smile. Things like Laundry (cheap), Hamam and Coiffeur were practically next-door to "Best Nobel-Hotel". Excellent air-conditioned Tramway-system works about 200 meters away all-day long. They are mostly - though not always, crowded - but they are constantly in motion, one doesn't need to wait for long next tram. Just choose your deodorant and you'll fit in! What comes to noises - WHO said that the Town with approximately 12-16 MILLION (!!) people is SILENT? In my room there were no disturbing noises despite of the busyness of the City - I don't mind that so much on vacation. All kinds of Shops and services like Photography, Pharmacies etc. are nearby and the Sirkeci-area is FULL of all kinds of restaurants - like Istanbul in general. There's ALWAYS some nice place for each "sizes" of wallets - no worry!. Bazars, near-the Bridge(s) market places, Squares and many Mosques are within walking distance. Besides Yellow-Cabs, Metro is great (test Funicular-ride to Taksim) and even Buses of various kinds works relatively well - so there's no problem in moving around in Istanbul! Also recommended is a visit to "Princes Islands" by boat - a nice trip and beautiful island(s) with plenty of services! Stay overnight. All in all, Istanbul was a pleasant surprise to be such a BIG City - felt safe there (probably peoples behavior in general). I can recommend "Best Nobel-Hotel" for couples and particularly for sole-travelers as a well-grounded choice - specially in the sense of Price-Quality-Location relation. Almost into the same breathe it has to be mentioned that English Company called "JustinTime.com Hotels" proved to be well capable of arranging a room quite SOON with the reasonable price-level if one is late, or (suddenly) decides to reserve a Hotel-room, for example just a few days prior to departure. Thank you Istanbul and have a nice summer for ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic , good location. Nothing great, but no complaints either”
Reviews.Author: xywalker
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is probably its location and its proximity to the big attractions in istanbul. I felt the hotel is quite basic and functional, rooms were ok. Was only here for a night due to a mix-up with my primary hotel booking. For the same price, i think there are better hotels in the neighborhood. The internal lift was a bit scary - no doors on it!! With kids be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Sober but perfectly positioned”
Reviews.Author: Mac2Gent_Belgi_
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of about 15 students three periods of six days over the last three years. Breakfast is OK, rooms pretty clean but rather small, especially the numbers 106, 206, 306 etc. Rather noisy when people talk on the stairs or the landing. Good bed but a small wardrobe would be welcome. Personnel is very kind and helpfull. Situation is ideal: Topkapi, Aya Sophia, Spice and Big Bazaar, Archeol. Mus. etc. are all within a few minutes walking and the tramvay even closer. There are plenty of retaurants and cafÃ©s.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Terriew40
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my time at this hotel. I found the reception area clean, tidy & tastfully decorated. The staff i found to be very helpful and friendly. This was a comfort, as a woman travelling on her own. I found my room a bit small at first, but loved it by the time i left to go home. Though, I would have liked a wardrobe rather than a hanging area!...I would have loved a wider selection at breakfast, a little variation...but saying that, if you want a clean, friendly, well located hotel...I would recommend this one. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst not so Nobel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smillingbuddha
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel i have stayed in. Only good thing was the location They completely overcharged us for the rooms. These rooms were tiny and cramped and the walls were so thin you could hear people using the bathroom next to us. There was construction being done one night and we could hear loud banging for most of the night. We called down 5 times as well as went down in person to ask them to make the banging stop The staff was unprofessional and extremely rude. They yelled at us when we complained about the banging Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for traveller”
Reviews.Author: lenmuh
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Very close to train station, harbour, main historical attractions. Rooms are small but good enough for rest when you travel much.Clean enough, frienfdly and helpfull stuff. Reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “possibly the worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: lizGeneva
Reviews.Content: romantic weekend for two in istanbul, only it ended up being us two, plus a bed crawling with fleas, which could be visibly seen. my partner was badly bitten, and yet the hotel refused to take any responsibility and were even reluctant to change our rooms. horrid, would highly not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money ...”
Reviews.Author: BernyLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel as we read that it had been modernised over a year ago... Although it was modernised we found the rooms very small, not very clean (glass marks on the beside table maybe from last guest, bathroom with broken glasses on the floor and bedsheets broken). The best thing was the location ... but look for soemthing else if there is available.

Reviews.Title: “Marginally better than sleeping on the street”
Reviews.Author: e2mq173
Reviews.Content: We were obligted to stay at this hotel as a part of the holiday for 'On-the-Go Tours'. Quite simply I cannot recall anything that was done well. The rooms where so small that two people cannot walk around at the same time. Every shower in the hotel seems to flood the bathroom. The shower head in my room came off completely (just as well because it helped to minimise the flooding). It was impossible to get extra towels - forget about a smile from the receptionist! Rooms on the first floor are very noisy. Quite honestly I would not stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Best Nobel Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: EbuSuud Cad Saffeti Pasa Sk No:8 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
